result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin A Palmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin A Palmer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Setnencing after revocation hearing 7-18-17 filed by court reporter Marjorie Kurtz
Associated with Charge #1

3:32am/3:59pm  Defendant Kevin A Palmer in court, in custody with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court imposes: 3 years prison with 18 months initial & 18 months extended supervision.  Sentence consecutive to any other sentence now serving.  Any financial obligations to be condition of extended supervision.  289 days jail credit. Eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not the Challenge Incarceration Program.

for Good Time Credit filed by Atty. Piel
Associated with Charge #1
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Piel

Defendant Kevin A Palmer in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called:  13CM421, 13CM712, & 14CF74.  Rights/Elements.  In 13CM421 defendant plead guilty to Cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  Ct. 1  $443.00 costs.  Ct. 2.  10 days jail with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence.  $443.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Court.  Dismiss Ct. 3.  No jail credit.  In 13CM712 defendant plead guilty to Ct. 1.  Court accepted plea, found defendant guilty.  Judgment was entered.  $768.00 fines/costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Court.  Dismiss Cts. 2 & 3.  No jail credit.  In 14CF74 defendant plead guilty to Ct. 1.  Court accepted plea, found defendant guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Withhold sentencing, placed on probation for 3 years.  12 months jail with Huber, consecutive to 13CM421.   $1694.00 fines/costs.  36 mo. DL revocation.  AODA and comply.  DNA sample and surcharge.  24 mo. IID.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  May serve sentence in Sauk County.  No jail credit.  Dismiss Ct. 2.

Defendant Kevin A Palmer in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Palmer would like all cases for defendant to have a plea/sentencing at the same time and date.  He is to contact Br. 2 judicial assistant immediatly after court to set a date and time.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Disposal of CIB card.
